alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 21 at 1:22AM MST until January 22 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 MPH with gusts up to 60 MPH possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds may be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing and drifting snow will be possible which could lead to poor visibility and difficult travel.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
